direction.raw_text: We'll have a good time. Paulie opens the front door and gives Rocky an encouraging smile...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's ya sister like to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ice skate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't want no turkey anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Thanksgiving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To you, to me it's Thursday. INT. ICE SKATING RINK - NIGHT Rocky and Adrian enter a deserted skating rink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks quiet, y'know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think it's closed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think mebbe we're early or somethin' -- From across the rink a CLEANING MAN yells at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, whatta ya doin' here -- we're closed... Yo, we're closed!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are ya closed to the General Public or to just everybody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, the rink is empty 'cause we're closed -- ya ain't allowed in here so do me a favor an' not stay here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait here, gotta smooth this guy out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We could go somewhere else an' -- Rocky approaches the Cleaner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yo, pal, what's with you -- The place ain't operatin'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, I gotta problem.  This girl ain't feelin' well, y'know -- The doctor says she should exercise, y'know once in awhile an' ice skatin' is the best thing -- CLEANER This a con?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at her, ya can see she ain't feelin' good -- needs a few minutes exercise -- CLEANER Few minutes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Ten minutes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ten minutes for ten dollars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Yeah, give 'er the Blades. INT. ICE SKATING RINK - NIGHT Adrian has on skates.  Rocky follows her onto the ice.  He wears street shoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Aren't you skating?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't skated since I was fifteen -- That's when I started fightin' -- gotta watch the ankles.  Yeah, fightin' use to be tops with me, but no more.  All I wanted to prove was I weren't no bum -- That I had the stuff to make a good pro.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you never got the chance? The Cleaner yells from the sideline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nine minutes!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, I ain't cryin'... I still fight.  Kinda do it like a hobby.  See I'm a natural southpaw an' most pugs won't fight a southpaw 'cause we mess up their timin' an' look awkward -- Southpaw means lefthanded... But I guess in the long run things probably worked out for the best, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you never had a chance to prove yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eight minutes! Adrian slips and Rocky breaks her fall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just dislocated my finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ohh!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seven minutes!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It ain't your fault -- I originally done it in the Baby Crenshaw fight. (opens his wallet) That's me fightin' Big Baby Crenshaw -- Big Baby was the size of an airplane an' I broke my hands on his head -- I lost, but it's a nice picture, don't ya think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Six!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How 'bout some Cokes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cost ya a buck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This guy is beautiful -- get the Cokes. Adrian does a slight turn and Rocky has to speed up and nearly falls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, I ain't graceful, y'know -- I don't move good -- Stink as a dancer too -- But I can really swat, I hit hard,                real hard, but I'm a southpaw an' nobody wants to fight a southpaw! -- Havin' a good time? Adrian nods and is very nervous... The Cleaner moves carefully across the ice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Y'know how I got started in the fight racket?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By accident?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here -- Three minutes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah -- My ol' man who was never the sharpest told me -- I weren't born with much brain so I better use my body. For the first time, Adrian laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's funny?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My mother told me just the opposite.  She said, 'You weren't born with much of a body so you'd better develop your brain.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time! The Cleaner walks over as Rocky and Adrian get off the ice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's ten bucks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I must be goin' deaf 'cause I thought ya said, 'ten cents.' Rocky hands him a dime.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... How 'bout for the Cokes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charge it. Rocky and Adrian start to leave.  Rocky pauses at the door and fishes into his pocket and hands over eleven dollars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Had ya goin', didn't I, huh? He grins and leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. STREET - NIGHT ROCKY Some people are very shy by nature.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I suppose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would say you're very shy bu nature.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I suppose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some people think bein' shy is a disease, but it don't bother me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't bother me either.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then why did I bother bringin' it up?  'Cause I'm dumb, that's why... Y'know, I think we make a real sharp coupla coconuts -- I'm dumb an' you're shy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... It is just hard for me to understand why anybody wants to be a fighter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya gotta be a little soft to wanna be a pug... It's a racket where ya' almost guaranteed to end up a bum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think you're a bum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I'm at least half a bum. Yeah, fightin' is a crazy racket.  The roughest part is the mornin' after.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning after?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After a rough fight, ya' nothin' but a large wound. Sometimes I feel like callin' a taxi to drive me from my bed to the bathroom... Ya' eyes hurt, ya' ears hurt, ya' hair even hurts... But the thing I'm proud of is I been in over sixty fights an' never had a busted nose -- Bent an' twisted an' bitten but never broke... That's rare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you do it if it hurts so bad?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Guess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Cause you can't sing or dance? Rocky smiles. INT. ROCKY'S APARTMENT - NIGHT Rocky and Adrian enter his one-room apartment... She is nervous and taken aback by the bleakness of the room... Rocky goes to the icebox.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would ya like a glass of water?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... No thanks. Adrian looks at the mirror above Rocky's dresser.  She sees a high school photo of Rocky.  He once was handsome and smooth-faced... Rocky steps up behind her and his face is reflected in the mirror. He turns on his cheap RECORD PLAYER... He reaches into the turtle bowl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here's the guys I was tellin' ya about -- This is Cuff an' Link.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I sold them to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Oh, yeah, I bought the whole kit -- Yeah, ya sold me the turtles, the bowl, an' the mountain -- I had to get rid of the mountain 'cause they kept fallin' off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have a phone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had it pulled.  People callin' all the time.  Who needs it -- Who'd you wanna call?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanna let my brother know where I am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: D'you really wanna call?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think he might be worried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll call your brother. Rocky flings open the window and bellows like a foghorn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!Yo, Paulie -- Ya sister's with me!  I'll call ya later. Rocky closes the window and faces the woman... She is not smiling.  She looks frightened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter?  Ya don't like the room?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's only temporary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not that -- ROCKY What's the problem?  You don't like me -- Don't like the turtles -- What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think I belong here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I don't belong here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all right -- You're my guest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I've never been in a man's apartment before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're all the same.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not sure I know you well enough -- I don't think I'm comfortable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yo, I'm not comfortable either.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I'm willin' to make the best of this uncomfortable situation. Adrian moves to the door... Rocky intercepts her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would ya take off your glasses?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The glasses... Please. Rocky removes her glasses and looks deeply into her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... T-thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do me another favor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could ya take off that hat. After a moment, Adrian removes the hat... She is becoming rather pretty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I always knew you was pretty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't tease me. The woman melts into the corner and begins lightly sobbing... Rocky steps forward and fences her with his arms and body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanna kiss ya -- Ya don't have to kiss me back if ya don't feel like it. Rocky softly kisses the woman... Her arms hang limp.  He puts more passion into the kiss and she starts to respond. Her hand glides like smoke up his back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She embraces his neck.  The dam of passion erupts.  She gives herself freely for the first time in thirty years. EXT. GOLDMILL'S GYM - DAY The following day, Rocky strolls down the street to Goldmill's Gym... Out front a group of young blacks stop talking and study Rocky as he passes.  Rocky's eyebrows knit in confusion. INT. GOLDMILL'S GYM - DAY Rocky climbs the stairs and enters the gym... ... In a matter of seconds, his presence is known and the athletes stare in wonderment... The big black heavyweight contender, Dipper, throws down his towel in disgust and turns away. Mike quietly approaches Rocky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Rock -- What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Bout what? Mickey Goldmill steps out of his office...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did ya get the message, kid?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Message -- What message? Mickey pulls out a card from his breast pocket... He hands it to Rocky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rep from Miles Jergens' Promotions was lookin' for ya -- They need sparrin' partners for Creed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya puttin' me on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here's the card?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When was they here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Bout an hour ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Probably lookin' for sparrin' partners.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I said that before. Rocky turns from Mickey and jogs out of the gym.  Mickey fumbles with his rosary beads.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Waste of life. EXT. SKYSCRAPER - DAY Rocky steps off a bus in mid-town Philadelphia.  He hurries down Broad Street.  Every few steps he breaks into a trot... He enters a skyscraper. INT. OFFICE BUILDING - HALL - DAY Rocky exits the elevator and enters the office of Miles Jergens' Productions. INT. JERGENS' PRODUCTIONS - DAY The SECRETARY is slightly startled by Rocky's excited expression.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I help you? Rocky hands her the business card.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your name, please?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Balboa, Rocky Balboa. The Secretary rises and enters Jergens' office... Rocky eyes the multitude of sporting pictures hanging on all four walls. The Secretary returns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You may go in. Rocky collects himself and enters...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. JERGENS' OFFICE - DAY Miles Jergens warmly greets him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Mr. Balboa -- I'm Miles Jergens -- Please, have a seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Balboa -- ROCKY (overriding) Rocky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rocky, do you have any representation?  A manager?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No -- Just me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rocky, would you be interested in -- ROCKY Sparrin'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know ya need sparrin' partners -- I'm very available.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure you are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely -- Sparrin' with the Champ would be an honor -- y'know what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't take no cheap shots. I'd be a good sparrin' partner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Jergens seems very amused.  He lights a cigar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rocky, would you be interested in fighting Apollo Creed for the Championship?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Like I said, I'd make a boss sparrin' mate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you hear what I said?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, an' I'm smart enough to know that no sparrin' partner should take cheap shots at the Champ.  He's just there to help condition the man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not spar, I'm asking whether you would be interested in fighting Creed for the championship. The weight of the statement comes crashing down in Rocky. For a long moment he becomes nothing more than a basket case as he ponders the statement... He half regains his senses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Ah... Absolutely. The SCENE FADES and becomes a black and white television. INT. PAULIE'S APARTMENT - NIGHT Rocky and Adrian are at her home watching an old black and white television... Rocky smiles... The film now cuts to Apollo being interviewed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How'd you like the 'City of Brotherly Love?'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like my Philadelphia Brothers. An' I'm patriotic! Apollo has to move to the side to avoid a thrusting microphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If yo' don't back up I'm gonna send yo' home with a microphone in yo' nose! The Reporters laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did you agree to fight a man who has virtually no chance of winning?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If history proves one thing, everybody gotta chance -- Didn't yo' all ever hear of David an' Goliath? -- 'Course I woulda knocked out Goliath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is a coincidence that you're fighting a white man on the most celebrated day in the country's history?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The same coincidence that he's fightin' a black man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're your feelings about the challenger?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's Italian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does that mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It means if he can't fight, I bet he can cook! Rocky and Adrian laugh at the interview... Paulie, her brother, takes offense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do me a favor -- His lungs, punch 'em out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paul.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Rocky's interview now fills the screen.  Rocky squints and looks nervous under the hot lights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is your largest payday ever -- How do you feel about it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Feel?  I dunno... Happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How will you fight Apollo Creed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Creed's great, ain't he... I'll do what I can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where did you get the name, 'Italian Stallion?'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought of it 'bout eight years ago, when I was eatin' dinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it true the most you've ever made in a prizefight is five hundred dollars?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Four hundred -- But that was a long time ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now your payday will be one hundred and fifty thousand dollars.  Any comment?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, I wanna say hi to my girlfriend -- Yo, Adrian! Adrian blushes and laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Rocky!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christ.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure I did.  You heard. They continue to watch the remainder of the interview... The head COMMENTATOR is looking directly into the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bicentennial Fight -- January first.  It will be the first sporting event on our two hundredth birthday and is already being called by many the greatest farce in sports history.  If this man lasts more than a minute I would say he's on borrowed time. (sarcastically) It's matches like this with their exorbitant prices that give sports a bad name -- Not only is this match bad, people, it's sad!  Why a Rocky Balboa?  At the State Athletic Commission, Larry Duggan reporting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The guy's a friggin' moron.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't it matter none he's makin' ya out a fool? -- I'd break his lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It don't matter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's takin' cheap shots.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It don't bother me none.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yo, Rock -- now ya'll be lookin' for people to help, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Y'know, to help keep ya livin' clean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll do okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya gotta have a guy help ya exercise, mebbe somebody to be standin' by with a towel or run errands, y'know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, who cared about me yesterday, huh?  Nobody -- I think I'm gonna train myself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Without havin' good people around, ya won't have such a good chance. Adrian is not happy with her brother's overbearing attitude. She faces him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Einstein flunked out of school... twice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roosevelt finished last in his class -- Beethoven was deaf, an' Helen Keller was blind -- I think Rocky has a good chance. INT. HALLWAY OF PAULIE'S APARTMENT - NIGHT Rocky stands in Adrian's doorway.  He kisses her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See ya tomorrow. Rocky moves down the stairway and continues to do so as he converses with Adrian who remains upstairs.  His VOICE ECHOES up the stairwell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How'd ya like hearin' ya name on TV?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know -- I was shocked. Why did you do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya puttin' me on, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely -- What time should I expect you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Bout seven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be waiting. Rocky is now on the ground floor yelling up to Adrian on the top floor landing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Y'know how I said that stuff on television didn't bother me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It did. As Rocky completes the last word, he exits the building and slams the door which RESOUNDS throughout the apartment house. EXT. ATOMIC HOAGIE SHOP - NIGHT Gazzo, the bodyguard, and Rocky are standing out front. They are eating hot sandwiches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Y'know I won't be able to work for ya no more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey -- if a good man can make a better life, let him make it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I feel bad about walkin'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take your shot, kid -- You got money for trainin' expenses?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A few bucks. Gazzo takes out a wad and peels off several bills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here's five hundred -- Put it in your glove.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do I have to pay juice? Gazzo looks at the Bodyguard and shakes his head as if to imply, "Why's this guy asking such a foolish question?" Gazzo and the bodyguard step to the white Caddy parked at the curb.  They enter the cab.  Rocky watches. INT. CAR - NIGHT GAZZO (smiles) Does Santa Claus charge juice? Merry Christmas -- Now, how's about my present, ya gonna win?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gonna try.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, kid, I'm with ya.  Ya know, I'm with ya -- Italian, we're blood.  You kill this rug -- We Guinneas gotta show these Afro-Americans where it's at.  Give it your best shot cause I want ya to prove to these bums on the corner that my man can't be beat by this rug... Ya got any action on the side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No action.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya gettin 150 grand killer. Ya got any plans for it? Whatta ya think? (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya like to put it on the street, make it work for ya?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna do somethin with it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, you do what ya want. Stay away from the stock market.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Black market?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Same thing.  Ya know, Rock, remember when we was kids, we fought together.  An' I wasn't well an' ya had to beat up that Irish kid -- what's his name? -- Gallager -- I bought a suit and became a businessman. You put on gloves.  An' I remember Mama almost cried, may she rest in peace -- an' our ol' man who said ya had no brains -- I'd like to lay hands on that bastard.  You ain't never had any luck. Even when I owned you in '66 you never had luck.  But now I think you might be gettin' some luck kid.  Whatta you think? Rocky smiles and Gazzo gets into his car.  Rocky follows him across the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yo, you gonna show, Tony?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where else am I gonna go. (to Bodyguard) Bet three grand on Rocky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a bum -- are you kiddin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!  I'm not kiddin! Rocky walks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. ROCKY'S APARTMENT - NIGHT Rocky returns home and enters his apartment.  After turning on the light, he flips on his RECORD PLAYER.  He now feeds the turtles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look who's home! Rocky notices two telegrams laying inside the threshold.  He approaches them with a sense of awe.  He opens and reads one. Settling on the bed, he reads the other. A KNOCK is HEARD.  Rocky opens the door.  Mickey Goldmill, the gym owner, stands framed in the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I seen the light.  I figure somebody was home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Mickey -- Whatta ya doin' here?  Here, sit down. Rocky tosses soiled clothing off a mangled armchair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Best seat in the house -- Hey, Mick, this is too much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm usta seein' ya at the gym, but seein' ya here, in my house, it's kinda outta joint. By the manner in which Goldmill listens, it is obvious something important is preying on his mind. Rocky is slightly uncomfortable, almost embarrassed at having outsiders see how he lives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, Rock, you're a very lucky guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's happened is freak luck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Freak luck for sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at all them other fighters. Real good boys.  Good records. Colorful.  Fight their hearts out for peanuts -- But who cared?  Nobody.  They got it shoved in their back door. Nobody ever give them a shot at the title...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Freak luck is a strange thing. Mickey does not hear.  His attention is drawn to the turtles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatta' those?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turtles -- domestic turtles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm here tellin' ya to be very smart with this shot.  Like the Bible sez, ya don't get no second chance. Mickey looks hard into Rocky's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya need a manager.  An advisor. I been in the racket fifty years.  I done it all, there ain't nothin' about the world of pugilism that ain't livin' up here. He lights a half-smoked cigar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifty years, huh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifty years.  The rep is known around Philly, an' a good rep can't be bought, but I don't have to tell you that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How 'bout a glass of water?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rocky, d'ya know what I done?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I done it all.  I've done an' seen everything'.  Believe what I'm tellin' ya -- Ya shoulda seen the night in Brooklyn, I smacked 'Ginny' Russo outta the ring, September
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . FADE IN: EXT. STREET - DUSK Rocky and Paulie walk towards his house... Even though it is cold and dark, a group of kids conduct an energetic game of half-ball. (Half-ball is a variation of stick-ball.)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: same night Firpo knocked Dempsey outta the ring. But who got the Press?  He did. He had a manager -- September
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya got a good mind for dates. Mickey deafly continues, becoming more engrossed every second.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at this face -- twenty- one stitches over the left eye, thirty-four over the right -- my nose was busted seventeen times, the last being the Sailor Mike fight New Year's Eve, 1940, in Camden, New Jersey -- What a professional pastin' I give him.  Here, read about it. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An' he give me the vegetable on the ear.  I got pain an' experience... an' you got heart -- kinda remind me of Marciano, ya do. Rocky points to his most prized possession.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody ever said that -- There's his picture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, ya kinda remind me of the Rock.  Ya move like 'im. Mickey has rung the bell.  Nothing could please Rocky more than being compared to his idol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really think so?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya got heart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heart, but I ain't got no Tocker. Rocky shifts against the wall and lowers himself into a crouch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christ, I know this business. Rocky, when I was fightin' it was the dirtiest racket goin', see.  Pugs like me was treated like fightin' dogs -- throw ya in the pit an' for ten bucks ya try to kill each other.  We had no management... (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: fought in boxcars, in whorehouse basements, any joint with a floor -- October
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (shows a tiny press clipping; points to cauliflower ear)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: I fought a bum who put a tack in the thumb of his glove an' punched so many holes in my face I had spit shootin' outta my cheeks -- I never had no manager watchin' out for me -- See that picture outside the gym -- 'Mighty Mick,' that's me in my prime.  I had all the tools.  I coulda starched any lightweight husky on the East Coast -- But I had no management.  Nobody ever got to know how slick I was, but I had a head for business an' stashed a few bucks an' opened the gym -- It's a dirt hole, I know it, but that an' a lotta scars is what I got to show for fifty years in the business, kid -- now you come along with this shot an' I feel like it's me gettin' the shot I never got... Yeah, we was treated like dogs -- like them Dago's, no offense, in the Colosseum in Rome there -- An' now I got all this knowledge, I wanna give it to ya so I can protect ya an' make sure ya get the best deal ya can! Rocky rises and opens a window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Respect, I always dished ya respect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Ya gave Dipper my locker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, I -- I made a mistake.  Kid, I'm askin' man to man.  I wanna be ya manager.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The fight's set -- I don't need a manager.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, you can't buy what I know.  Ya can't.  I've seen it all!  I got pain an' I got experience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got pain an' experience too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, kid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever I got, I always got on the slide.  This shot's no different.  I didn't earn nothin' -- I got it on the slide... I needed ya help about ten years ago when I was startin', but ya never helped me none. Mickey drops the ashtray and kneels to pick it up... He remains on one knee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If ya was wantin' my help, why didn't ya ask?  Just ask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I asked, but ya never helped nothin'! -- Like the Bible sez, ya don't get no second chance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rocky, I'm seventy-six years old.  Maybe you can be the winner I never was -- your shot is my last shot! Rocky is choked and goes into the bathroom and closes the door. Mickey struggles to his feet and, like a beaten man, leaves. Several moments later Rocky steps out and lowers himself into bed.  Springing up a second later, he runs outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. STREET OF ROCKY'S APARTMENT - NIGHT Rocky races up the block toward the shadowy and hunched form of Mickey.  Way in the distance, we SEE Rocky stop the old man beneath a street lamp.  He places an arm around his shoulder. INT. ROCKY'S APARTMENT - PRE-DAWN The following morning, Rocky's ALARM CLOCK GOES OFF at exactly four A.M.  Not accustomed to rising this early, with great difficulty Rocky staggers to his feet and wavers to the bathroom.  He turns the light on and roaches scatter. At the top of the mirror hang the telegrams.  Rocky fills the basin and submerges his face in cold water. Rocky sways to the icebox and removes a dozen eggs.  He cracks five raw eggs into a glass and downs it in one swill... his body quivers. EXT. STREET OF ROCKY'S APARTMENT - PRE-DAWN Rocky steps outside.  He is dressed in a well-worn sweat suit with a hood, gloves and sneakers.  It is pitch dark and his steaming breath attests to the cold. He begins running down the center of the deserted street. He can only be clearly SEEN as his form passes beneath the street lamps. Two garbage men stop hoisting cans to watch him pass. EXT. ART MUSEUM STAIRS - DAWN Rocky stands at the base of an overwhelmingly steep flight of stairs.  He stares up at the stairs that nearly disappear into the morning gray.  Taking a deep breath, he starts up. From the start, he looks out of shape and halfway up his legs give way.  Standing, he brushes off and descends the stairs. EXT. CITY HALL - DAWN Rocky passes City Hall and veers to the river.  He pauses, heaving great gusts of exhausted breaths.  He throws several lazy jabs in the air and walks awhile with hands on his aching sides.  Men delivering the morning papers observe with amusement. Rocky forces himself to begin running again. 70. EXT. ELEVATED TRAIN STATION - DAWN Heading along Spring Garden Street, Rocky passes beneath an elevated train station.  The ROARING TRAIN overhead seems to blend perfectly with his muscular running style. EXT. DOCKS - DAWN The sky is beginning to lighten.  The fighter now runs along the piers and past anchored freighters. EXT. EASTERN PACKING COMPANY - DAWN It is five-thirty and Rocky approaches the loading platform belonging to Eastern Packing Company.  Alongside the loading platform come several boxcars. Rocky mounts the ramp and knocks on the metal door.  It soon opens and Paulie guides him inside.  Paulie is drunk. INT. SHIPPING OFFICE - DAY PAULIE How ya feelin'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Tight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got whiskey here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... No. Rocky notices TWO PUERTO RICANS lounging alongside theshipping office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the guy who's fightin' Apollo Creed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good luck -- Kill him, man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hip -- Hip -- Hooray!  C'mon -- Hip -- Hip -- 71.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hooray, man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rock'll be comin' by every mornin' to pick up some Prime -- can't train on that store crap. Rocky smiles and Paulie leads him out of the office and to the large metal door of a walk-in refrigerator. INT. FREEZER - DAY They enter.  The freezer resembles a modern torture chamber... row after row of hanging slabs of beef stretch into the darkness to the far end of the refrigerator.  The blower overhead causes the men to speak loudly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If ya don't pay Gazzo, ya end up hangin' on the hook, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gazzo's a good man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How 'bout you talk to 'em about me? (tightly) Please do me that favor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep this job, ya eat better. Paulie opens a jackknife and idly jabs the hanging meat.  He swills whiskey from a pint bottle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Y'know, d'ya think you an' my sister -- Ah, doin' good together?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatta you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't sure, what's the story?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The story -- what's happenin'? Paulie speaks like a man who has been mulling this over for quite a while.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya really like her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure I like her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the attraction?  I don't see it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno -- she fills gaps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What gaps?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She got gaps.  I got gaps -- together we fill the gaps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ballin' her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't talk dirty 'bout ya sister.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon, ya screwin' her? From across the room Rocky looks him hard in the eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's why I can't put ya together with Gazzo, cause ya talk too much -- big mouth. Paulie reddens.  He steps forward and slams his fists in a hanging beef.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The punching of the beef is a muted challenge and Rocky responds. Rocky walks up to a beef and slams his fist into the ribs. The grotesque object swings in a wide arc like a hanging corpse.  Rocky moves to the next one and hooks. Rocky's face reveals a never before seen concentration, as though he were locked in total battle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hit the rump.  The rump! Ya'll break the ribs! Rocky speeds up and continues pounding on the second row of beef.  Paulie's eyes widen and his face grimaces with every punch, like he were receiving it.  Rocky moves into the dark recess of the refrigerator.  Only the dull SOUNDS of his POUNDING FISTS can be HEARD. Rocky works his way to Paulie again.  Every hanging beef swings and appears surrealistically alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We do that to Creed an' they'll take us to jail for murder. Rocky looks at his hands.  They are drenched in red up to the elbows with beef blood. Paulie hands him a package of beef.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't talk dirty 'bout ya sister. Rocky takes the package and runs out.  Paulie's bleary eyes reveal a fearful respect and slight resentment. INT. GOLDMILL'S GYM - DAY The gym is filled to capacity.  The NOISE is DEAFENING. Rocky pounds a heavy bag. Mickey steps forward and removes a piece of string from his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop!  Stop!  I can't stand it! It's clumsy.  You're off balance. He motions to his bullish helper, Mike.  He hands him the string.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tie it to both ankles -- Leave two feet slack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never had good footwork. Mike completes the task.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget the footwork -- You're off balance.  The legs are sticking everywhere.  Marciano had the same problem, an' the string cured it.  When you can hit and move without breakin' the string you'll have balance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll be a very dangerous person. Two young boys in street clothes interrupt Mickey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rocky, could we have your autograph?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you boys ever interrupt when I'm conductin' business, or I'll kill you both -- Go away. The boys depart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Autographs!  Ya wanna be a writer or a fighter?  Let's work. Mike looks off across the gym.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... we got visitors. Mickey strains his eyes to see a group of REPORTERS and NEWS CAMERAMEN entering his gym.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I help you guys?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Set the camera up over there. (to Mickey) We're from Channel Seven -- Covering the pre-fight training.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I own the place. The Reporter has a hundred things on his mind... he turns from Mickey and nods to his crew... the other television crews rush to set up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rolling here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Speed here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're here at Goldmill's Gym -- A Philadelphia landmark of sorts since 1929 -- The stench of toil permeates every corner.  The sweat a trademark of a unique profession... Yet, the most unique fixture is an unprecedented 50 to 1 underdog heavyweight named, Rocky Balboa. The camera turns to Rocky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should I do this? Mickey nods and Rocky faces the glaring lights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So much has happened lately -- Has it changed your life style much?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... People talk to me more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How're you preparing for this Bicentennial bout? A young punchy fighter yells out:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Readin' fuckin' history books, man! The gym explodes with laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can cut that out later. Apollo Creed says he'll let you stay three rounds before he puts you away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Apollo's a great fighter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you feel you have a chance?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe -- He faces Mickey.  Mickey whispers in his ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tear his head off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have anything derogatory to say about the Champion?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Derogatory?  Yeah, he's great. Apollo Creed and his entourage enter the gym.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am the Champion of the whole world!!! The gym freezes... everyone turns and stares in wonderment... Mickey Goldmill shakes his head in disbelief.  He now realizes it is a publicity stunt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Italian Stallion, I come over to tell you to be very smart an' after this fight donate what's gonna be left of your body to science, cause after this fight what's left won't fill a tuna fish can!... So beware, Mon Cher!!! Apollo turns to the cameras... Rocky is speechless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This classic fight -- Tha's right, this bicentennial fight's goin' down in the history books 'cause January first I'm gonna be the first man to bounce another man offa the planet Pluto! Dipper stands in the far ring... the attention Rocky is receiving makes him a killer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now I gots a special announcement, y'hear.  For the first time in alotta years this championship fight is gonna be on your home T.V.! Free -- 'Course that's just for Philly -- My present to the city... (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now some ya'll ain't much on likin' me, but ya gotta admit Apollo Creed is one DAMN generous, 100% pure, government inspected, Afro-American Folk Hero!!! Everyone laughs... Dipper moves across the room like a large snake.  He brushes people aside and steps behind Rocky.  He nudges him... Rocky thinks it is an accident and ignores it. Dipper pushes harder and Rocky looks questioningly at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya nothin', Boy! Apollo stops his sales pitch in mid-sentence... The television crew faces Dipper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I say ya nothin'!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's happenin' here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm happenin'!  This pig is takin' my shot -- I iz a contender.  He's nothin'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yo', Dipper, why're ya -- DIPPER (shaking his fist) Spar me in front of these here
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: dudes -- I knock ya ass to Jersey! Dipper's fat black trainer holds out his hands and Dipper slaps them soul style.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can forget about sparring, kid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yo' know I iz the best man here!  Yo' said so yoself!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why let Rocky here take a chance on cuttin' or breakin' a hand? -- Take a shower, Dipper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't mouth me, old man, I'll knock yo' out too.  C'mon, wop, spar me, let everybody see who's got the heat around here. Silence looms over the gym... Apollo is apprehensive.  The scene is becoming too real.  The frightened television crew slyly begins putting away their expensive equipment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man, yo' best keep them cameras out!  Fight me, boy! Let Creed here see the kind of punk he's fightin'! Mike forces his way through the crowd and stands behind Rocky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't chance it, man -- He's sick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is gettin' outta hand -- Rocky will fight in the ring January first, not here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yo' yellow, old man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not yellow, cautious. (to the crew) See, it's very easy for a fighter to accidentally hurt -- Dipper suddenly steps forward and slaps Rocky very hard across the side of the head... The gym becomes stone cold. Dipper is in total command and enjoying every moment of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If yo're afraid to fight me, then get down an' kiss my feet, boy. Mickey looks nervously around and knows it's only seconds before the blood will run... Rocky stands motionless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's take a walk, Rock. Please, don't take a chance. He wants to hurt you so you can't fight. Rocky swallows his pride.  He still has the string around his ankles.  He starts to shuffle away with Mickey... Dipper steps forward and viciously slaps Rocky again. Mike jumps forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why you tryin' to cut 'im, man! Back off, scumbag, or I'll bite your face! Dipper cuts loose with a hook and knocks Mike flat.  The room reeks of fear... Apollo's eyes flick back and forth between Rocky and Dipper.  Apollo taps his bodyguards and they begin to ease away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Now, boy, kiss my feet. Rocky eyes his friend lying on the floor.  He shuffles forward and stands before Dipper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Kiss 'em. Rocky looks at Mickey, then lowers his eyes to Dipper's feet... Dipper smiles.  Rocky starts to bend towards the shoes.  Without warning, he explodes with a pair of combinations into Dipper's exposed ribs.  A CRACK is HEARD and Dipper sinks to the floor writhing in pain... The room is silent except for Dipper's moaning. Apollo is stunned by the scene.  The gym has become a very gloomy place.  He eyes Rocky with admiration and a hint of apprehension... He leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Mickey is the first one to shake off the chill... He shakes his fists at the Reporters, and puts his arm around Rocky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The kid's got cannons -- Print that. The crowd disperses, leaving Dipper a pathetic and broken figure lying on a dirty gym floor. INT. ROCKY'S APARTMENT - NIGHT They enter the dismal apartment... On the floor are at least ten telegrams.  Rocky scoops them up and tosses them aside. Next to the door is a pile of over a hundred telegrams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you open them anymore?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They either say, 'Kill the nigger' or 'Hope you die, Honky.' -- What ya got in the bag? Adrian steps to the window.  She pulls a pair of short but lovely curtains from a shopping bag... The colorful curtains glare in the dark room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sharp -- Real nice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really -- You don't think they're overly feminine?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... Sharp -- You look great. Adrian smiles and pulls out a small Christmas wreath... Rocky smiles.  His eyes show what he feels for this woman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adrian, you really look great, y'know -- But I can't fool around durin' trainin' -- makes the legs weak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't want weak legs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't fool around -- You look very great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The legs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... But I think weak legs ain't bad sometimes, y'know. Rocky approaches in a seductive manner.  Adrian uncharacteristically removes her sweater.  Underneath is a T-shirt that reads "Win, Rocky, Win."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought it might be cute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya right -- (laughs) Mebbe we best just hold hands -- the shirt made me feel guilty, y'know. SCENE FADES. EXT. STREET - PRE-DAWN Rocky is running... for extra weight he carries his huge dog, Butkus.  After a half a block he sags under the weight, and laughing, begins to wrestle with the dog on the pavement... Rocky tries to sneak away from the dog, but after a few steps the beast sees him and chases him down the street. EXT. EASTERN PACKING COMPANY - DAWN It is early morning and as usual Rocky jogs to the meathouse. He is followed by his new dog, Butkus.  He is stopped short when he notices several television news vans parked out front. INT. EASTERN PACKING COMPANY - DAWN He and the dog enter the freezer area and see several reporters and men with mini-cameras milling around... Paulie is waiting for him -- Rocky is upset and goes outside. Paulie follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. EASTERN PACKING COMPANY - DAWN PAULIE Yo, Rock.  I made a few phone calls an' thanks to me ya goin' to be a big man -- Thatta dog?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatta these guys want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To see ya train.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yo, what's with you? -- It was suppose to be private.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought I was doin' ya a favor -- C'mon inside -- Y'know, my sister really likes ya. Rocky follows Paulie inside. INT. EASTERN PACKING COMPANY - DAY A REPORTER points in Rocky's direction and suddenly he is surrounded and led into the freezer area and positioned beside a slab of hanging beef.  The camera lights go on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just relax, Mr. Balboa -- (to the camera) Today we're here with heavyweight challenger, Rocky Balboa.  The reason we are standing in a refrigerated box is that Mr. Balboa has an unusual method of training and in a moment he is going to demonstrate it for our viewing audience -- But first, Rocky, how did you ever come to train in an icebox?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah -- My buddy Paulie let me in one day an' I hit the beef here an' liked it -- An' since I become a challenger, the owner don't mind neither.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this a common training method -- I mean do other fighters pound raw meat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think me and Paulie invented it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you give us a demonstration? Rocky steps over to a hanging beef and begins pounding with incredible intensity... Everyone present is taken aback. Rocky completes hitting the meat and stands there with his hands dripping beef blood. The Commentator is unnerved and Rocky looks straight into the camera lens and holds up his bloody fists.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Diane Lewis in the meathouse with the Southpaw, Rocky Balboa. INT. JERGENS' OFFICE - DAY Apollo sits behind Jergens' desk.  Jergens is not present. Four middle-aged and younger types and Creed's lawyer sit around the desk.  The desk is flowing with forms and charts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much is being channeled into West Coast closed-circuit advertising?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three hundred thousand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make it four hundred an' fifty. (to younger man) Send two hundred roses to the mayor's wife from me, get a picture an' make sure it gets all the papers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do ya want to run the fifteen radio spots in the mid-west? I think you could spend the money better in Canadian publicity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I'd like to get Canada -- see, if we can get a tax break -- Gimme the figures on the Program Concession. Meanwhile, the trainer sits across the room in a darkened corner looking at a small television.  He is watching Rocky's bloody exhibition on the news... He waves at Apollo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Apollo, you oughta come see this boy you're gonna fight on
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks like he means business. Apollo is still engrossed in his paperwork.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean business, too -- (to men) The gross rental of the arena is gonna include the four hundred ushers, right? -- Gimme some coffee. EXT. PAULIE'S STREET - NIGHT It is a moonless night and Paulie staggers across the street and enters his building... He staggers up the stairs. INT. PAULIE'S APARTMENT - NIGHT Paulie removes his coat and tosses it listlessly in a chair... He rubs his red eyes and sways into the kitchen. He takes a bottle of wine out of the icebox.  As he swills the wine he hears the SOUND of Rocky's and Adrian's VOICES traveling from his sister's room.  Paulie's face tightens and he staggers towards the bedroom. He stands outside the bedroom door and peers through a crack... Rocky, Adrian, and the dog are watching TV in the otherwise darkened room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... And he called the reporters -- ROCKY Yeah... Threw my whole day off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be mad at him -- He just wants to help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yo -- I ain't mad.  I'm just outta joint when reporters are around -- They take cheap shots an' Paulie knows it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Are you going to say anything to him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... What's to say?  I dunno what he wants from me -- Filled with uncontrollable anger, Paulie smashes into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothin'!  I want nothin' from you!!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paulie!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shutup!  I want nothin' -- I ain't no charity case!  Get outta my house!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not your house -- PAULIE You ain't no friend no more -- Go home!  Outta my house I want ya!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't talk like that to him!
direction.name: direction

ANOTHER ANGLE Apollo stands in his corner and jokes with the fans, but he is beginning to show the strain from the body punches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man, I rearranged his face with that right -- The people love what's happenin' tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People nothin', you in a fight, my man, -- ya best believe what you hear... Knock that boy out soon an' let's go home. ANOTHER ANGLE Rocky sits as Mickey and Benny try to reduce the swelling around his eyes... The nose is shattered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya nose is broke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn!  How's it look?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't hardly tell.  Don't swallow the blood -- Go for his ribs.  Don't let 'im breathe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... The guy's great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't ya tell 'im you're a fan! ANOTHER ANGLE The Commentators are caught up in the action.  They speak rapidly into their microphones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you had asked anyone who knows boxing, they never would've predicted a first round knockdown and the second round punishment to the body of the Champion... Most fighters will tell you, receiving a good body punch is the next worst thing to dying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Round three ready to start and should be interesting to see if Creed can put the challenger away -- there goes the bell. ANOTHER ANGLE Round three... Apollo comes out dancing.  He skips and side- steps Rocky's sledgehammer hooks.  An expert ring general, Apollo uses the ring fully.  Rocky keeps tearing in and Creed meets the bombing attack that cause thick swelling... Near the end of the round Rocky fires a penetrating punch to the heart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Apollo almost sprints out of his corner -- feints and throws a pair of left-right combinations.  Balboa drops beneath a left upper cut and lands a very solid shot on Creed's temple -- not much movement from Balboa, duck a left, a right, another left and explodes with a right hook to the temple -- I mean explodes.  The Champ backs off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no way Apollo expected this kind of hitting power.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No way -- but the brilliant ability of the Champion to master situations like this is one of his most outstanding traits -- Creed tosses a perfect right hand that rocks Rocky. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Creed on the offensive -- Balboa takes the punishment and counters with a left flush over the heart... that hurt. The wallop knocks Apollo off balance... The CAMERA GOES TO A STEEP ANGLE SHOT from the floor, VERTICALLY UP Apollo's body. The SCENE GOES INTO SLOW MOTION... Rocky releases a terrifying uppercut that opens a gash under Creed's eye. Creed's face contorts with excruciation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cover your face!  Cover up! (to Assistant) My man's cut, my man's bleedin' -- Get ready! ANOTHER ANGLE The BELL SOUNDS.  Apollo's corner works frantically to close the wound... The ring DOCTOR inspects the cut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bad?  Talk to me, man!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deep, but passable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... That man's takin' his job too serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's movin' to your left -- don't let him no more -- dance and stick, hear?  Don't play -- I know what ya feelin', but don't play.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He got lucky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luck!  You fightin' a crazy man -- but you got him hurt bad. (to Assistant) More ice, now!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ANOTHER ANGLE Rocky's face is in very bad shape, not cut, but wretchedly swollen around the eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How you holdin' up, kid?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine... That guy's great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gimme the water!  Ya getttin' tagged with his right.  I think you should feint left and high hook 'im -- Benny, check the eyes!  Can ya see?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya sappin' his strength -- He's losin' steam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He ain't losin' nothin'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep on him -- You're doin' great. SERIES OF SHOTS In the next ten rounds, Apollo cuts and slashes Rocky to ribbons, but pays dearly... Both his eyes and lips are cut. Welts across his midsection attest to Rocky's body-battering. INT. ROCKY'S DRESSING ROOM - NIGHT Adrian is unable to remain alone... She is lured by the GROWING ROAR OF THE FANS... She exits the dressing room. INT. ARENA HALL - NIGHT Stepping out of the dressing room she walks down the corridor. The MOUNTING CHEERS make her speed up.  She opens the door at the end of the corridor and is hit by a THUNDEROUS WAVE OF SOUND.  The guard at the door inspects her and goes back to watching the fight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. ARENA - NIGHT Adrian stands at the rear of the arena and watches the battle.  She is entranced by the power of it all. Back in the ring, Rocky keeps grinding ahead.  He plants a thumping left over the Champion's heart and Creed winces... Rocky is game but losing. At ringside Paulie is frantic... He is living the fight from his seat. Mr. Gazzo and his Bodyguard watch from the second row. Gazzo looks proud.  The Bodyguard, impassive. INT. ANDY'S BAR - NIGHT A huge and lively crowd look up at the television over the bar... They see Rocky driving Creed against the ropes and cheer loudly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... The Rock's got real stones. INT. ARENA - NIGHT The men are fighting with appalling tenacity.  Rocky rips and tears into the body... Apollo counters with a ceaseless stream of rapier-like lefts... The Challenger is seriously outclassed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon -- Lemme cut yo'! Rocky wades in and Creed employs incredible footwork.  He sets himself and cuts loose with a thunderbolt right cross to Rocky's already broken nose.  Blood sprays from the wound and red droplets drip from his chin... Rocky takes a merciless beating and is staggered by a torrent of combinations.  Rocky's eyes are closed.  But Creed cannot drop him... The BELL RINGS. ANOTHER ANGLE The Commentators shift in their seats.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Without a doubt this is the most punishing brawl I have ever seen -- The ringside audience is spotted with blood. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This fight should have been stopped rounds ago but Rocky Balboa refuses to fall -- COMMENTATOR #2 Not only has he refused to fall, but he has beaten the Champion's body without mercy and the bout has become a vicious slugfest. ANOTHER ANGLE Apollo's corner is in turmoil... The Champion is definitely hurt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get that doctor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No doctor!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're hurtin', man!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No doctor!... I'm feelin' good, bro! ANOTHER ANGLE In Rocky's corner, things are frantic.  His eyes are swollen shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wanna keep goin'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you keep goin'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No more, ya wanna lose an eye? No more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Open my eyes -- Please, open my eyes! Mickey nods to Benny.  He secretly places a small ring knife between his index and middle finger.  In one smooth movement he drags the razor over the blood welts and quickly covers the draining wounds with gauze... It is done so quickly no one is ever aware of the operation. ANOTHER ANGLE At the rear of the arena Adrian looks transfixed at the ring. She is caught up in the heat of the battle. ANOTHER ANGLE The BELL RINGS for round fourteen.  Rocky bores in close, but Apollo still has spring in his legs.  He seems determined to end it this round... Apollo catches Rocky flush on the jaw.  Rocky is staggered.  Like a wolf, Apollo cuts loose with pure savagery.  Rocky is driven against the ropes and receives a devastating beating from the Champion... Rocky is dropped. Rocky sits stunned in the middle of the ring... Everything is a distortion.  He looks for familiar faces as though to ask for help... Mickey and Mike scream frantically for him to stay down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Six -- Seven -- Eight -- Rocky gets to his feet and tenses with renewed energy.  He is like a wounded wild animal.  The tide suddenly turns. Rocky drops low and catches Apollo with a pair of terrific body punches that seem to drive Apollo's diaphragm up to his throat... A CRACK is HEARD.  A glaze of pain covers Apollo's eyes.  It is only a supreme effort that keeps the Champion upright... Apollo is badly hurt.  He is bent over. Rocky moves towards Apollo.  Apollo flicks dread jabs into Rocky's eyes... The Italian wades in with punches that seem to bulge out Apollo's back.  Creed takes the punishment like a stoic. Blood is running from Apollo's mouth.  In the clinch he leans over Rocky and it drips down the Italian's neck and shoulders.  Apollo shields his wound from the ringside judges and continues to fight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ANOTHER ANGLE The BELL RINGS.  Apollo's men rush out and guide him to his corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Ribs broke -- Blood trickles from the corner of Apollo's mouth.  The Trainer feels the ribs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yo' bleedin' inside, man -- Get that doctor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One more round.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't kill yourself, man -- Let the doctor stop the fight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Stop jivin'!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cover the ribs -- Look here, elbow down, tight -- Tight -- stand straight -- you're the best, you're the best!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Thanks. ANOTHER ANGLE Rocky no longer resembles himself... His face has completely been beaten to jelly, but his mood is buoyant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How I look out there, Mick?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great, kid, great. The ring Doctor leans over Rocky and checks the eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One more round -- How do you feel? Rocky is approaching the supreme moment of his life.  He cannot be bothered with pain or doctors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine -- Go away, I'm gonna make it -- I'm gonna make it! Everyone is distraught over Rocky's dangerous condition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We gotta stop it, kid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya gave it ya best shot!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody's gonna say ya didn't give ya all.  I can't let ya go out. Rocky stands and eyes them all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll kill ya all... Don't stop nothin' -- ANOTHER ANGLE The BELL RINGS... Apollo moves cautiously out of his corner and circles to Rocky's right. ANOTHER ANGLE The Commentators stare unansweringly at the fighters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The fight has slowed down to a near stand-still -- Creed circles to Rocky's right... The spectrum is nearly silent -- Neither fighter has made a motion to throw... I've never seen anything like it in the last round of a championship fight... Apollo spits blood on the canvas.  It appears he is protecting his right side.  His ribs were probably injured at the end of round fourteen. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's confirmed, unofficially, Creed's ribs may be broken -- Apollo fakes a left and throws a big tired right -- Balboa's mouthpiece is out!  Creed attacks with one hand! ANOTHER ANGLE Apollo feints and Rocky falls for it.  The Champion unleashes a lethal blow to the side of the head that jolts Rocky's mouthpiece into the second row... Rocky sags against the ropes in a crucified position... The insane crowd leaps to their feet. ANOTHER ANGLE Rocky's bloody teeth snarl at Apollo and he waves him to come ahead and fight toe to toe... Apollo obliges with a weary but effective burst of rights and lefts that have K.O. written on every punch.  Rocky counters the assault blow for blow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gimme ya best!!!! Mickey looks at the clock... TEN SECONDS TO GO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gimme ya best!!! Blood sprays over the ropes and onto the ringside photographers... They are horrified and wipe away the blood. The fighters stand toe to toe and drag every remaining bit of strength from their souls and beat each other without mercy.  They look hypnotized and have entered a dimension far beyond blood and pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Their cornermen rush to their collapsed fighters... In the midst of all the confusion both fighters look at each other with unabashed respect -- They stand like blood-drenched gladiators on the most dramatic night of their lives. As though reacting to some unspoken command, they both step towards each other and embrace... Apollo whispers in Rocky's ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Ain't gonna be no rematch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Don't want one. Mickey comes over and separates them and leads him back to his corner... Mickey embraces him. ANOTHER ANGLE The Announcer enters the ring with a microphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Attention, please!!  Attention!! Ladies and gentlemen, tonight we have had the rare privilege to have witnessed the greatest exhibitions of stamina and guts ever in the history of sports. The CROWD ROARS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ladies and gentlemen -- We have a split decision! ANOTHER ANGLE Apollo did not expect this and tenses.  His corner nervously tries to reassure him.  It does no good. ANOTHER ANGLE Rocky did not expect this either and looks in confusion at Mickey, but Mickey is frozen with anticipation. ANOTHER ANGLE ANNOUNCER Judge Walker scores it eight- seven Creed... Judge Roseman scores it eight-seven Balboa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ANOTHER ANGLE Apollo is rigid.  Fear radiates from his eyes.  To lose the crown on this night after the fight he fought would kill him... A silence has blanketed the arena. ANOTHER ANGLE ANNOUNCER Judge Conners scores it nine- six Creed... Winner and still Heavyweight Champion of the World, Apollo Creed! ANOTHER ANGLE Rocky sorely smiles and looks at the waves of CHEERING fans that circle the ring and reach out towards him... Mickey grabs Rocky's hand and raises it.  The CROWD ROARS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care what they say, you're a winner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yo, can I have my locker back? Mickey and Rocky look at each other and grin.  Mickey hugs Rocky like a son.  Mickey raises Rocky's hand again.  Rocky turns away from Mickey and pats Benny the cut-man's shoulder... Benny smiles wearily.  Rocky stares across the ring at Apollo Creed, who stands victorious, but his face and body are badly distorted... The two men lock stares that reflect admiration. ANOTHER ANGLE Apollo climbs out of the ring and the fans crush forward screaming his name and waving red, white and blue banners. ANOTHER ANGLE Rocky also climbs out of the ring and waves of frantic well- wishing fans rumble forward... Mickey's eyes show mounting apprehension as the fans become abnormally active. ANOTHER ANGLE They shove the police aside and clutch wildly at Creed. Creed's army of bodyguards swing angrily at the crowd but they are soon engulfed by screaming waves of humanity. Apollo is suddenly hoisted into the air and is being carried along by a legion of fans.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ! ANOTHER ANGLE The BELL RINGS... The arena EXPLODES with thunderous approval.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: SIX FIVE FOUR THREE TWO ONE
